channel.title: Multicombat Area help! Rep++!
channel.description:
[center][size=14pt][u][b]Issue Status:[/b][/u]RESOLVED[/size] [/center] Okay so I need to make an area that is currently a [u]"safe non-multicombat"[/u] area. [b]This is my Multicombat() void:[/b]
public boolean multiSafe() { if((absX <= 2540) && (absX >= 2510) &&(absY <= 4660) && (absY >= 4630)) return true; else return false; }
[b]To add new coordinates I know I have to add this:[/b]
|| (absX >= a && absX <= b && absY >= c && absY <= d)
[b][u]In what order do I take the coordinates?[/u][/b]
|| (absX >= a && absX <= b && absY >= c && absY <= d)
Like is "A" and "B" supposed to be the North-East and South-West X coordinates? and "C" and "D" the North-East and South-West Y coordinates? If someone can please explain this to me [b]I will rep++[/b]! Thanks!

item.title: Multicombat Area help! Rep++!
item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:2, topic:425867”]|| (absX >= a && absX <= b && absY >= c && absY <= d)

absx = sw
absx = ne
absy = um…if I remember correctly thats se
absy = nw

hopefully i didn’t get them backwards but I think thats correct. You can look at a funpk tut and they normally tell you about coords[/quote]

Yes, that was correct. I tried using a funpk tut, but it was wrong.

I would rep++ you if I could.
Thanks.

Read full topic

|| (absX >= a && absX <= b && absY >= c && absY <= d)

absx = sw

hopefully i didn’t get them backwards but I think thats correct. You can look at a funpk tut and they normally tell you about coords

item.title: Multicombat Area help! Rep++!
item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

[center][size=14pt]Issue Status:RESOLVED[/size]

[/center]

Okay so I need to make an area that is currently a “safe non-multicombat” area.

This is my Multicombat() void:

public boolean multiSafe() { if((absX <= 2540) && (absX >= 2510) &&(absY <= 4660) && (absY >= 4630)) return true; else return false; }

To add new coordinates I know I have to add this:

|| (absX >= a && absX <= b && absY >= c && absY <= d)

In what order do I take the coordinates?

|| (absX >= a && absX <= b && absY >= c && absY <= d)

Like is “A” and “B” supposed to be the North-East and South-West X coordinates?
and “C” and “D” the North-East and South-West Y coordinates?

If someone can please explain this to me I will rep++!

Thanks!

Read full topic
